description: Numbers whose set of base 14 digits is {0,1}.
comments: Sums of distinct powers of 14.The base 14 digits may comprise zero, one, or both. - _Harvey P. Dale_, May 12 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1023
formula: a(n)=Sum{d(i)*14^i: i=0, 1, ..., m}, where Sum{d(i)*2^i: i=0, 1, ..., m} is the base 2 representation of n.a(n) = A097260(n)/13.a(2n) = 14*a(n), a(2n+1) = a(2n)+1.a(n)=Sum_k>=0 {A030308(n,k)*14^k}. - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Oct 20 2011
author: _Clark Kimberling_
